intro: Origanum integrum, commonly known as Greek oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, fuzzy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are widely used in cooking and traditional medicine for their pungent, spicy flavor. Origanum integrum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in dry, rocky conditions.
